name: Complete Whitening Pack
desc: Using a whitening toothpaste or mouthwash, trying whitening pens, strips or trays are all good ways to supplement your normal oral hygiene habits.
advantages: Straight, white teeth are no longer just for celebrities. Advancements in cosmetic dentistry over the last several years have made teeth whitening safer.

name: Sedation Dentistry
desc: Sedation dentistry uses medication to help patients relax during dental procedures.Patients are usually awake with the exception of those who are under general anesthesia.
advantages: Ease of Treatment. Whether you struggle with a gag reflex or have sensitive teeth or gums, sedation allows the Whitlock team to perform.

name: Dental Cleaning
desc: Most teeth cleanings are performed by a dental hygienist. Before the actual cleaning process begins, they start with a physical exam of your entire mouth.
advantages: It brightens your smile.Your teeth can get stained by certain food and drinks.Bad breath is reduced. The best way to reduce bad breath.

name: Cosmetic Dentistry
desc: If you’re not satisfied with your smile, modern cosmetic dentistry can help. This method of professional oral care focuses on improving the appearance.
advantages: Improved self-confidence. The benefits of improved self-confidence aren't easy to measure.Improved dental health.

name: Fissure Sealants
desc: Fissure sealants are a white or clear composite resin, similar to a white tooth filling. The sealants provide a barrier against bacteria that can cause plaque.
advantages: Sealants are durable under the force of normal chewing and can last several years before reapplication is needed.Easy to apply.

name: Oral Mucosa
desc: The oral mucosa is the mucous membrane lining the inside of the mouth. It comprises stratified squamous epithelium.The oral mucosa is classified into three categories.
advantages: The oral mucosa has several functions. Its main purpose is to act as a barrier. It protects the deeper tissues such as fat, muscle, nerve.

name: Aligning the Teeth
desc: Teeth alignment is typically corrected through two methods: braces or aligners. In some cases, contemporary braces may be more appropriate  to address your orthodontic needs and budget.
advantages: Proper alignment enhances tooth and jaw function, thus maximizing long-term oral health and comfort. Proper alignment increases the longevity of the dentistry.

name: Child’s First Dental Visit
desc: The first dental visit is recommended by 12 months of age, or within 6 months of the first tooth coming in.The first visit often lasts 30 to 45 minutes.
advantages: Scheduling your child's first dentist visit early is crucial for preventing cavities. Seeing the dentist early on in life will also help your child get used to

name: Caries Removal
desc: Selective Caries Removal in Permanent Teeth (SCRiPT) for the treatment of deep carious lesions: a randomized controlled clinical trial in primary care.
advantages: Conservative removal of tooth tissue for both primary and secondary caries reduces the risk of failure due to tooth-restoration
